commitResults.messageBody: this will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-3#47

The current Reminder implementation only allows user to assign at most one Reminder to a contact, which is undesirable as there could be multiple reminders for multiple events with one contact.

To allow multiple Reminder for each contact, we should store a Collection of Reminder instead of a Reminder in the Person class.

Letâ€™s
* Add a ReminderList class for a list that is catered to only the Reminders
* Change the Reminder field in Person to ReminderList

This commit will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#49

The current Reminder system implementation does not provide a way to display reminders. 

This commit will provide two ways to view the reminders. One way is to specify the contact index, in which all of the reminders associated with the specified contact will be displayed. Otherwise users can choose to specify a date, in which all of the reminders happening on the specified date will be displayed. In the event which the date is not given, reminders happening today will be shown instead.

Let's
* Add ListDateReminderCommand to execute list reminders by date command.
* Add ListDateReminderCommandParser to parse user inputs to ListDateReminderCommand.
* Add ListContactReminderCommand to execute list reminders by contact command.
* Add ListContactReminderCommandParser to parse user inputs to ListContactReminderCommand.

This commit will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#50

The current implementation of the Reminder class does not capture the comparable nature of the Reminder dates.

Let's
* Add a ReminderDate class to add the comparable property.
* Add a ReminderDescription class to capture the ReminderDescriptions.

This commit will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#47

Add function to filter contacts by a tag
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing tagging system is under-developed, as users cannot do
anything else, besides adding and removing a set of tags.

To provide users a better user experience, users will be able to filter
contacts by a tag, just like Instagram tag filtering system, with the
command `#TAG`. Example: #friends will filter those contacts that are
tagged with `friends`.

Let's,
* Add an alternate path in parseCommand to return HashtagCommand
* Add HashtagCommand for the execution of the filtering by Tag
* Add HashtagCommandParser to parse user input to a Tag object
* Add case-insensitive hasTagIgnoreCase(Tag) to check if Person has Tag
* Add PersonContainsTagPredicate to test if a Person is tagged to a Tag
* Add case-insensitive equality check isSameTagIgnoreCase(Tag) in Tag

This commit mainly uses the existing abstraction only.

Resolves #34 less test cases (see the next commit).

This commit will allow users to add tags to a specified contact, one at
a time, instead of overwriting all the tags.

* Add AddTagCommand for add tag command execution

The implementation mainly uses the existing abstraction.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support to show all tags
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing tagging system do not allow user to list all the tags that
are in the AddressBook.

This commit will allow user to list all existing tags in AddressBook.

The tags for the command will not be persistent (not saved in storage),
and will only be kept in memory. During runtime, the list of tags will
be populated in UniqueTagList and then updated accordingly upon every
command affecting the tag list.

Let's,
* Update AddressBook to hold UniqueTagList that will hold all tags
  * Initialise UniqueTagList in the constructor
  * Update all CRUD methods to update UniqueTagList
  * Add methods getUniqueTagList, getNumberOfUniqueTags to handle tags
  * Improve equals' readability
  * Update equals and hashCode to include UniqueTagList in comparison
* Update AddressBookParser
  * Rename isValidCommand to checkEmptyArguments, with method JavaDoc.
  * Add an alternate path in parseCommand to return ListTagsCommand
* Add method signatures for this command to Model
  * Add getUniqueTagList()
  * Add getNumberOfUniqueTags()
  * Update ModelStub in AddCommandTest
* Implement getUniqueTagList(), getNumberOfUniqueTags() in ModelManager
* Update Tag to be comparable alphabetically
* Improve equals' readability in Tag
* Add ListTagsCommand for list tags command execution
* Add interface for UniqueTagList for read-only purposes
* Implement UniqueTagList to keep track of all tags in AddressBook

ReadOnlyUniqueTagList is designed to protect UniqueTagList so that
other classes cannot modify UniqueTagList. It is also reinforced by
getCopy method of UniqueTagList, so that the original copy is immutable
by other classes.

Resolves #33.

commitResults.messageBody:
Some parsing process of HashtagCommandParser was done in
AddressBookParser and violates the SLAP and SRP.

This commit also upgrades the HashtagCommandParser, by using
ArgumentTokenizer.tokenize method using hashtag prefix, that uses the
existing classes rather than writing primitive statements, like
.substring and .startsWith.

Let's
* Shift isHashtagCommand to HashtagCommandParser
* Utilise ArgumentTokenizer.tokenize in isHashtagCommand
* Utilise ArgumentTokenizer.tokenize in HashtagCommandParser
* Shift isHashtagCommand test cases to HashtagCommandParserTest
* Make minor changes to HashtagCommandParserTest for the changes made

commitResults.messageBody:
The DocumentedDate class has a check that throws an
IllegalValueException.

As future increments would fix input and ensure LocalDate
parameters passed to the DocumentDate class would be valid,
such a check is unnecessary.

Let's remove this check for better code readability.

The addressbook does not hold birthdates for contacts. To allow
users to store birthdates for contacts, we need to create
a birthdate field for each contact.

Let's do the following to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#28:
- Create a BirthDate model
- Update Person model to hold BirthDate
- Update FXML and person card to show BirthDate on GUI
- Ensure dependencies are functional
- Update and write new tests for BirthDate

The edit birthDate feature has bugs and is unable to update. To
handle the edit feature properly, we need to ensure functionality.

Let's do the following:
- Update EditCommandParser
- Update isValidDate method
- Update BirthDate::equals method
- Add more tests for edit feature
- Patch code based on PR review suggestions

commitResults.messageBody:
The application does not allow users to look for persons with
birthdays today easily. This prevents them from having a
snapshot of who to send well wishes to.

Let's do the following to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#58:
- Add a predicate to use for filtering for birthdays
- Add a designated command for applying the predicate filter
- Write tests for edge cases for better code and path coverage

General commands like list, exit, help, clear and birthdays
can accept input with arguments. This may be considered a bug.

To prevent improper usage of the application, we should change
the command input acceptance to be stricter.

Let's do the following to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#60:
- Add a check for general commands
- Update tests to check for improper argument usage

Application window shows the name of Address Book Level 3. This
is not representative of our product.

Let's change the name to AIA App to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#61.

The application will discard existing save file when an error
occurs during reading. This is detrimental because the user will
lose all data if they made a small error during a manual edit of
the save file.

Let's create a backup of the save file upon receipt of an Illegal
Value Exception in the readAddressBook method.

This will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#64.
